paper_title: Probing the effect of P-doping in polymeric carbon nitride on CO 2 photocatalytic reduction

catalyst.source: In this work, P-doped polymeric carbon nitride (CN) photocatalyst was synthesized by one-step copolymerization of guanidine hydrochloride and phosphonitrilic chloride trimer.
catalyst.context: Developing highly efficient photocatalysts is of crucial importance to solve energy crisis and global warming issues.In this work, P-doped polymeric carbon nitride (CN) photocatalyst was synthesized by one-step copolymerization of guanidine hydrochloride and phosphonitrilic chloride trimer.The doping of P in CN was found to alter the electronic structure, enhance the charge separation and transfer, and promote the CO2 adsorption and activation, making it an efficient CO2 photoreduction catalyst.Under the optimized P dose, the CO evolution amount on P-doped CN reached 0.349 mol (30 mg, 3 h), which was 3.5 times that of pure CN.The process of CO2 photoreduction on P-doped CN was investigated by in-situ FTIR analysis, revealing that P doping could promote the formation of CO2 -intermediate.A possible mechanism has been proposed, which may provide new insights into the effect of non-metal elements doping in CN on its CO2 photocatalytic reduction performance.

catalyst.context: In summary, we have studied CO 2 photocatalytic reduction performance of P-doped polymeric carbon nitride (CN).Compared with pure CN, P-doped CN has higher performance in the photoreduction of CO 2 to CO.More importantly, the mechanism of P-doping effect on the catalytic activity has been probed in-depth.The doping of P atoms alters the electronic structure of CN by promoting the electron delocalization, prolonging the charge carrier lifetime and elevating the utilization of photogenerated charge carriers.P doping could also enhance the alkalinity of basic sites, thereby promoting the adsorption and activation of CO 2 .Mechanistically, the P doped CN catalyst plays a role of electron donation to CO 2 in the CO 2 photocatalytic reduction under illumination, forming CO 2 -, and resultantly accelerating its transformation to CO.This work provides an example of improving CO 2 photoreduction performance by the modulation of electron structure and active sites.The understanding on the effect of non-metal element doping in CN on its CO 2 reduction activity will help to rationally design photocatalysts with enhanced performance and stability. operation mode.context: Developing highly efficient photocatalysts is of crucial importance to solve energy crisis and global warming issues.In this work, P-doped polymeric carbon nitride (CN) photocatalyst was synthesized by one-step copolymerization of guanidine hydrochloride and phosphonitrilic chloride trimer.The doping of P in CN was found to alter the electronic structure, enhance the charge separation and transfer, and promote the CO2 adsorption and activation, making it an efficient CO2 photoreduction catalyst.Under the optimized P dose, the CO evolution amount on P-doped CN reached 0.349 mol (30 mg, 3 h), which was 3.5 times that of pure CN.The process of CO2 photoreduction on P-doped CN was investigated by in-situ FTIR analysis, revealing that P doping could promote the formation of CO2 -intermediate.A possible mechanism has been proposed, which may provide new insights into the effect of non-metal elements doping in CN on its CO2 photocatalytic reduction performance.
